item.name: Wireless Embedded Solutions and RF Components

title: Amplifiers
body: These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs.Product Obsolescence Notice OBS120117WSD3, Dec. 2017Broadcom offers a broad selection of RF and microwave amplifiers including Power Amplifiers (PAs), Gain Blocks/Drivers, Low Noise Amplifiers (LNAs) and variable gain amplifiers (VGAs) for cellular applications and diverse markets such as wireless infrastructure, WiMAX, WLAN, test & measurement and other wireless microwave applications.Broadcom is leveraging its experience in handsets and base stations to offer new wireless products targeted at small cell base stations, macrocell base stations, and portable GPS/GNSS systems.
meta_keywords: rf and microwave amplifiers, rf amplifiers, microwave amplifiers, rf amplifier
meta_description: Broadcom offers a broad selection of rf and microwave amplifiers including power amplifiers, gain blocks and drivers, low noise amplifiers and variable gain amplifiers
CategorySummary: Broadcom offers a broad selection of rf and microwave amplifiers including Power Amplifiers (PAs), Gain Blocks/Drivers, Low Noise Amplifiers (LNAs) and variable gain amplifiers (VGAs) for cellular applications and diverse markets such as wireless infrastructure, WiMAX, WLAN, test & measurement and other wireless microwave applications. Broadcom is leveraging its experience in handsets and base stations to offer new wireless products targeted at small cell base stations, macrocell base stations, and portable GPS/GNSS systems.Power amplifiers in the MGA-43x28 series are ideal as a final stage PA for Picocell and Enterprise Femtocell systems with a PCB footprint 50% smaller than comparable devices. The MGA-43428, 43528, and 43628 target 3GPP bands 5, 2, and 1, respectively. The MGA-16x16 series of balanced ultra-low-noise amplifiers are designed for cellular infrastructure applications with industry-standard performance and twice the linearity of competing devices. The MGA-16116, 16216, and 16316 target the 450-1450 MHz, the 1440-2350 MHz, and the 1950-2700 MHz frequency bands, respectively.
CategoryAbstract: These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Broad selection of RF amplifiers including gain blocks/drivers, low noise amplifiers (LNAs) and variable gain amplifiers (VGAs) for cellular applications and diverse markets.

CategoryList.CategoryAbstract: These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Amplifiers specifically designed for applications such as small cell base stations, macrocell base stations, and portable GPS/GNSS systems.

CategoryList.CategoryName: Gain Block & Drivers Millimeter Wave Amplifiers
CategoryList.CategoryAbstract: These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Gain Block and Driver amplifiers covering DC to 6GHz applications.

These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Ideal for wireless infrastructure and mobile applications, these small cell amplifiers are designed for excellent linearity and high efficiency.

These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. A broad selection of low-noise amplifiers (LNAs) that have the industry’s best noise figure combined with excellent gain and linearity.
These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Variable gain amplifiers designed for use in wireless cellular applications.

These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. Broadcom offers a variety of amplifiers in wafer scaled packages including low noise and driver amplifiers covering 0.5 to 18GHz applications.
These parts are at end of life and should not be used in new designs. WiFi/LTE product solutions that are designed for use in a range of personal computers, laptops, smartphones and others.
